etymology.description: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") = tall mound of earth
etymology.interpretation: The character 垚(yáo, "tall of earth") is an ideogrammic compound representing the triplication of 土(土) (tǔ, "earth"), visually depicting a large, elevated mound or hill, emphasizing the idea of height or elevation in landscape.
